text:
I am running 3.2.1 and apache 1.3.19.
Running apache benchmark with 30 threads will cause tomcat to lock up after a
few minuets.  Tomcat will no longer respond to shutdown.sh and I have to killall
java. I think the problem may be in mod_jk.so as *sometimes* when this happens
apache will stop responding at all to even static content, however running the
benchmark agains static content will not cause the lockup to occur at all.
I'd like to give more info to help this get sorted out but dont know what else
to say.  I can reporduce the problem quite easily and am willing to work with a
developer towards a fix so just send me an email if I can be of any more help.
creator: orion@trustcommerce.com
orion@trustcommerce.com
text:
... More evidence that it is in mod_jk.so --- I noticed that when it happens,
one of the apache processes starts to hog the CPU untill I killall the java
threads.  Also I managed to get this to happen with only 3 threads hitting the
jsp pages (well, there were another 30 hitting jpg's) so it doesn't seem that
the level of load is very important.  It only took about 4 hours to kill it with
this low level of load.

creator: orion@trustcommerce.com
text:
Changed tomcat from apj12 to apj13.  The problem has gone away.  Whatever it is
I suspect it is in the apj12 code in mod_jk.

This wont' be addressed in 3.2.2.  Substantial work has already been done on 
mod_jk on the 3.3 branch so this may already have been addressed there.
